intro: Tradescantia ozarkana, commonly known as the Ozark spiderwort, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It features striking, showy flowers that bloom in early spring, typically in shades of pink to purple. The plant has strap-like, grassy leaves that are often variegated with white or silver markings. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sun. Tradescantia ozarkana is often found in woodland edges and moist meadows, making it a valuable addition to native plant gardens.
